verses.roman:
tatra nārāyaṇa-saras
tīrthaṁ sindhu-samudrayoḥ
saṅgamo yatra sumahan
muni-siddha-niṣevitam

synonyms: tatra—in that direction; nārāyaṇa-saraḥ—the lake named Nārāyaṇa-saras; tīrtham—very holy place; sindhu-samudrayoḥ—of the River Sindhu and the sea; saṅgamaḥ—confluence; yatra—where; su-mahat—very great; muni—by sages; siddha—and perfected human beings; niṣevitam—frequented.
translation: In the west, where the River Sindhu meets the sea, there is a great place of pilgrimage known as Nārāyaṇa-saras. Many sages and others advanced in spiritual consciousness live there.
